events.originalText: A freak storm triggered a series of avalanches that buried more than 3.5 km (2.2 mi) of road near the Salang Tunnel in Afghanistan, killing 175 people and trapping more than 2,500 travellers.
events.subtitle: 2010 Salang avalanches
events.headline: 175 killed in avalanches near Salang Tunnel in Afghanistan

events.originalText: The Irish-bred race horse Shergar was stolen by gunmen, who demanded a £2 million ransom.
events.subtitle: Shergar
events.headline: Race horse Shergar stolen by gunmen demanding £2 million ransom

events.originalText: Local police in Orangeburg, South Carolina, fired into a crowd of people who were protesting segregation, killing three and injuring twenty-seven others.
events.subtitle: Orangeburg, South Carolina
events.headline: Police fire into crowd in Orangeburg, South Carolina, killing three

events.originalText: After taking evasive action to avoid a mid-air collision just after taking off from New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport, Eastern Air Lines Flight 663 crashed into the Atlantic Ocean, killing all 84 people on board.
events.subtitle: John F. Kennedy International Airport
events.headline: Eastern Air Lines Flight 663 crashes after mid-air collision, killing all 84 on board

events.originalText: The official groundbreaking of the Walk of Fame took place in Hollywood, California.
events.subtitle: Groundbreaking
events.headline: Official groundbreaking of Walk of Fame in Hollywood, California

events.originalText: The closing ceremony of the first Olympics held after World War II was held in St. Moritz, Switzerland.
events.subtitle: 1948 Winter Olympics
events.headline: Closing ceremony of first post-WWII Olympics held in St. Moritz, Switzerland

events.originalText: Gee Jon became the first person in the United States to be executed by lethal gas.
events.subtitle: Gee Jon
events.headline: First lethal gas execution in the United States

events.originalText: William D. Boyce (pictured) established the Boy Scouts of America, expanding the Scout Movement into the United States.
events.subtitle: William D. Boyce
events.headline: William D. Boyce establishes Boy Scouts of America

events.originalText: Angered by a controversial umpiring decision, cricket spectators rioted and attacked the England team during a match in Sydney, Australia.
events.subtitle: Umpire (cricket)
events.headline: Cricket spectators riot and attack England team in Sydney, Australia

events.originalText: Richard Mentor Johnson became the only person ever to be elected Vice President of the United States by the Senate.
events.subtitle: Richard Mentor Johnson
events.headline: Richard Mentor Johnson elected Vice President of the United States by Senate

events.originalText: Robert Devereux, 2nd Earl of Essex, led a failed rebellion against Queen Elizabeth I of England.
events.subtitle: Robert Devereux, 2nd Earl of Essex
events.headline: Robert Devereux leads failed rebellion against Queen Elizabeth I

events.originalText: Mary, Queen of Scots (pictured), was executed at Fotheringhay Castle for her involvement in the Babington Plot to murder her cousin, Elizabeth I of England.
events.subtitle: Mary, Queen of Scots
events.headline: Mary, Queen of Scots, executed for involvement in Babington Plot
